website_summaries.verdict: If accessibility is an important factor, this is definitely a ladder to consider. Easy to assemble, and resists corrosion and rusting for years.
pros: Slanted treads easier for older and younger users
Assembly require minimal tools, instructions are well written
cons: Some pools may require longer lag bolts (not included)
Must be stabilized with sand or gravel

customer_reviews.title: Pool ladder for 27' round above ground
customer_reviews.text: Ladder arrived in a quick prompt manner was generally easy to put together and install in the pool. Negative is that it is not as sturdy as I would like considering I have 2 kids using the ladder. It is much better than the ladder that came with the pool so that is a plus. Overall, I only used this a short time and opted to spend more money and get a sturdy ladder that I felt was a lot safer for everyone using it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter F Neurohr

customer_reviews.title: If you don't mind drilling a whole in the top of the pool it is a great buy for the price the description is just misleading
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I misread the description but this ladder DOES NOT connect to the deck you have to drill wholes for the bolts on top metal tail of the pool and we could not get enough water in the ladder to keep it down in the pool either so had to put a weight on it to keep it from floating. It will work seems to be more stable than the other ladder. If you don't mind drilling a whole in the top of the pool it is a great buy for the price the description is just misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Francine

customer_reviews.title: The in pool ladder part is great. Wide steps
customer_reviews.text: The in pool ladder part is great. Wide steps, sturdy. The brackets also attached well to my deck though the bolts provided were not even close to being long enough to go through a deck. My only complaint is that the handles above the deck are very flimsy. They wobble when you hold them and feel like they might break if you leaned on them. Overall I would recommend the ladder.
